newsitem.title: MEXICO: Bidding open for Mexico natgas distribution permit.
newsitem.headline: Bidding open for Mexico natgas distribution permit.

text.p: The bidding process for the natural gas distribution permit for the northern Mexico zone that includes Chihuahua, Cuauhtemoc-Anahuac and Delicias officially started on Wednesday, the government Energy Regulatory Commission (CRE) said in a news release.
"An estimated investment amounting to more than $50 million is expected for this project in the following five years," the CRE said of the privatization project.
A single proposal must be submitted for the three geographic zones, the CRE said.
The distribution permit will be granted to the bid that offers the lowest average rate for distribution service. The bid also must meet certain technical criteria.
"The bidding process that starts today was triggered by the statements of interest of several leading companies in the natural gas industry," the CRE said.

The winner of the bid will be granted a distribution permit that will be valid for 30 renewable years and will include a 12-year exclusivity period on the construction of the distribution system and reception and delivery of natural gas within the geographic zone.
